intro: Roldana pennellii var. durangensis, commonly known as the Durango roldana, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Durango, Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a distinctive shape that aids in pollination by insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
